sentence.Network_en: Colleagues at work enjoy having a letterhead with their name at the top.

sentence.Network_en: When he gave her the letter, she immediately recognized the letterhead.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他把信给她时, 她马上认出了信笺的信头.

sentence.Network_en: Please provide evidence on original letterhead rather than notarized documents.
sentence.Network_cn: 请尽量提交含有相关抬头的原件,其次为公证件.

entry.tran: 信（笺抬）头（指印于信笺上端的个人、公司或组织的名称和地址）
entry.def: A letterhead is the name and address of a person, company, or organization which is printed at the top of their writing paper.

example.ex: Colleagues at work enjoy having a letterhead with their name at the top.
example.tran: 在职的同事可把其名字印在信头之上。

means.word_mean: 1. a sheet of stationery with name and address of the organization printed at the top
